_source.text: [0026] While the Messer Greisham approach can be better than the dynamic feedback approach in beveling operations, because the Z height is theoretically "correct" at the start of each machine movement, a problem still occurs where the approach of the torch is based on the assumption that Z varies linearly between the points that are actually measured in advance of the cutting operation.
